snippet.textDisplay: What better way to counter my denial of the cold season starting with a nice summer tune. Looking back, this game and its sequel were quite the unique and dark/depressing ride,  unlike anything I've played. Sure it gets some inspiration from some other games, but it's really its own thing. Interestingly, I remember seeing some tweets from the creator saying he actually hated Buddy/Lisa (the character) and regretted making the Joyful sequel, which was done because of a Kickstarter stretch goal before he even finished writing the story. As they say, you're often your harshest critic.
snippet.textOriginal: What better way to counter my denial of the cold season starting with a nice summer tune. Looking back, this game and its sequel were quite the unique and dark/depressing ride,  unlike anything I've played. Sure it gets some inspiration from some other games, but it's really its own thing. Interestingly, I remember seeing some tweets from the creator saying he actually hated Buddy/Lisa (the character) and regretted making the Joyful sequel, which was done because of a Kickstarter stretch goal before he even finished writing the story. As they say, you're often your harshest critic.

snippet.textDisplay:
I'm not too crazy about the sequel, myself. Buddy inexplicably becomes an edgelord who wants to conquer the world and kills (or, at least is sorely tempted to kill) a bunch of pacifists and Lisa, the protagonist of the first game who we've been given intimate insights into the hellish abuse she's suffered at the hands of her father (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Kb0YUvgBcVc), is suddenly revealed to have known Buzzo and she goaded him into mutilating small animals and cutting her with a buzzsaw. Okay... I don't remember any of that when I looked into every nook and cranny of her _mind_ but I guess that's canon, now.


On the other hand, the fangames, Pointless and Hopeful, are magnificent.
snippet.textOriginal:
I'm not too crazy about the sequel, myself. Buddy inexplicably becomes an edgelord who wants to conquer the world and kills (or, at least is sorely tempted to kill) a bunch of pacifists and Lisa, the protagonist of the first game who we've been given intimate insights into the hellish abuse she's suffered at the hands of her father (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Kb0YUvgBcVc), is suddenly revealed to have known Buzzo and she goaded him into mutilating small animals and cutting her with a buzzsaw. Okay... I don't remember any of that when I looked into every nook and cranny of her _mind_ but I guess that's canon, now.


On the other hand, the fangames, Pointless and Hopeful, are magnificent.

snippet.textDisplay: You don't like the cold season? To be honest it's my favorite time of the year. Also I don't think, this particular piece sounds like a summer tune 😂
snippet.textOriginal: You don't like the cold season? To be honest it's my favorite time of the year. Also I don't think, this particular piece sounds like a summer tune 😂

snippet.textDisplay:
Love how this song completely ruins its own tempo with the random drums in the middle of its hook, just driving an unsettling vibe into you like a nail.
I wonder if he'd update the game just to change the story, or even just touch up her dialogue to make her more likable in his eyes. I mean, from a business perspective it's a waste of time, but I'd totally do that in my spare time if I was a game dev.
snippet.textOriginal:

I wonder if he'd update the game just to change the story, or even just touch up her dialogue to make her more likable in his eyes. I mean, from a business perspective it's a waste of time, but I'd totally do that in my spare time if I was a game dev.

snippet.textDisplay: I also disliked the sequel and felt like it was done in a rush and/or not as polished as the painful, thanks for letting us know
snippet.textOriginal: I also disliked the sequel and felt like it was done in a rush and/or not as polished as the painful, thanks for letting us know

snippet.textDisplay: Interesting to know, I also disliked Buddy, even though she has some interesting moments in the Joyful. But some things definitely make more sense knowing this.

snippet.textDisplay: The whole soundtrack has something a little weird going on. Has a sort of vibe like, they only -kinda- know how to make music. It fits in a way, when it's a game mostly populated by washed up middle aged guys who maybe played music in high school.

I fucking love this game, and the soundtrack is absolutely amazing and should frankly be listened to more often by people.

snippet.textDisplay: Have you played Jimmy and the Pulsating Mass? It’s very much in the indie RPG mold of LISA, Undertale, et al. It’s an emotional roller coaster: lots of funny moments as well as tragic ones. Of course, it has excellent music as well.
snippet.textOriginal: Have you played Jimmy and the Pulsating Mass? It’s very much in the indie RPG mold of LISA, Undertale, et al. It’s an emotional roller coaster: lots of funny moments as well as tragic ones. Of course, it has excellent music as well.
